Event.name: Operate_vehicle_scenario
Event.definition: <def-root>This frame describes an <fen>Operator</fen> interacting with a <fen>Vehicle</fen> to transport him/herself (and possibly others) from a <fen>Source</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen>. The three primary stages are preparation for canonical operation, operation of the vehicle proper, and bringing the vehicle back to a state of rest, where it may continue to move but not in its typical fashion.</def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Vehicle</fen> is directed to move by the <fen>Operator</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>. This includes directional expressions and "middle of path'' expressions, e.g.:</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>Where the <fen>Vehicle</fen> ends up as a result of motion.</def-root>

Arg.name: Area
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Locative setting adjuncts of motion expressions may also be assigned this frame element.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the vehicle operation which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Operator</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action which enables the <fen>Operator</fen> to operate the <fen>Vehicle</fen>, or which more directly causes the <fen>Vehicle</fen> to operate.</def-root>
